frontmatter.title: Solving the illustrative G2EGM model with EGM^n
frontmatter.subject: Economics

children.value: The problem for a retired household

children.label: The problem for a retired household

children.html: wt(mt)\wFunc_{t}(\mRat_{t})wt​(mt​)

children.value: the problem of a retired household at time

children.html: ttt
m\mRatm

children.value:
. The
retired household solves a simple consumption-savings problem with no income uncertainty and a certain next period
pension of

children.html: θ‾\underline{\tShkEmp}θ​

wt(mt)=max⁡ctu(ct)+βwt+1(mt)s.t.at=mt−ctmt+1=Raat+θ‾\begin{split} \wFunc_{t}(\mRat_{t}) & = \max_{\cRat_{t}} \util(\cRat_{t}) + \DiscFac \wFunc_{t+1}(\mRat_{t}) \\ & \text{s.t.} \\ \aRat_{t} & = \mRat_{t} - \cRat_{t} \\ \mRat_{t+1} & = \Rfree_{\aRat} \aRat_{t} + \underline{\tShkEmp} \end{split}wt​(mt​)at​mt+1​​=ct​max​u(ct​)+βwt+1​(mt​)s.t.=mt​−ct​=Ra​at​+θ​​

children.value:
Notice that there is no uncertainty and the household receives a retirement
income

children.html: θ‾\underline{\tShkEmp}θ​

children.value: The problem for a worker household

children.label: The problem for a worker household

children.value: The value function of a worker household is

children.html: Vt(mt,nt)=Eϵmax⁡{vt(mt,nt,W)+σϵϵW,vt(mt,nt,R)+σϵϵR}\VFunc_{t}(\mRat_{t}, \nRat_{t}) = \Ex_\error \max \left\{ \vFunc_{t}(\mRat_{t}, \nRat_{t}, \Work) + \sigma_{\error} \error_{\Work} , \vFunc_{t}(\mRat_{t}, \nRat_{t}, \Retire) + \sigma_{\error} \error_{\Retire} \right\}Vt​(mt​,nt​)=Eϵ​max{vt​(mt​,nt​,W)+σϵ​ϵW​,vt​(mt​,nt​,R)+σϵ​ϵR​}

children.value:
where the choice specific problem for a working household that decides to
continue working is

children.html: vt(mt,nt,W)=max⁡ct,dtu(ct)−α+βEt[Vt+1(mt+1,nt+1)]s.t.at=mt−ct−dtbt=nt+dt+g(dt)mt+1=Raat+θt+1nt+1=Rbbt\begin{split} \vFunc_{t}(\mRat_{t}, \nRat_{t}, \Work) & = \max_{\cRat_{t}, \dRat_{t}} \util(\cRat_{t}) - \kapShare + \DiscFac \Ex_{t} \left[ \VFunc_{t+1}(\mRat_{t+1}, \nRat_{t+1}) \right] \\ & \text{s.t.} \\ \aRat_{t} & = \mRat_{t} - \cRat_{t} - \dRat_{t} \\ \bRat_{t} & = \nRat_{t} + \dRat_{t} + \gFunc(\dRat_{t}) \\ \mRat_{t+1} & = \Rfree_{\aRat} \aRat_{t} + \tShkEmp_{t+1} \\ \nRat_{t+1} & = \Rfree_{\bRat} \bRat_{t} \end{split}vt​(mt​,nt​,W)at​bt​mt+1​nt+1​​=ct​,dt​max​u(ct​)−α+βEt​[Vt+1​(mt+1​,nt+1​)]s.t.=mt​−ct​−dt​=nt​+dt​+g(dt​)=Ra​at​+θt+1​=Rb​bt​​

children.value:
and the choice specific problem for a working household that decides to retire
is

children.html: vt(mt,nt,R)=wt(mt+nt)\vFunc_{t}(\mRat_{t}, \nRat_{t}, \Retire) = \wFunc_{t}(\mRat_{t}+\nRat_{t})vt​(mt​,nt​,R)=wt​(mt​+nt​)

children.value:
The first step is to define a post-decision value function. Once the household
decides their level of consumption and pension deposits, they are left with
liquid assets they are saving for the future and illiquid assets in their
pension account which they can't access again until retirement. The
post-decision value function can be defined as

children.html: vt(at,bt)=βEt[Vt+1(mt+1,nt+1)]s.t.mt+1=Raat+θt+1nt+1=Rbbt\begin{split} \vEnd_{t}(\aRat_{t}, \bRat_{t}) & = \DiscFac \Ex_{t} \left[ \VFunc_{t+1}(\mRat_{t+1}, \nRat_{t+1}) \right] \\ & \text{s.t.} \\ \mRat_{t+1} & = \Rfree_{\aRat} \aRat_{t} + \tShkEmp_{t+1} \\ \nRat_{t+1} & = \Rfree_{\bRat} \bRat_{t} \end{split}vt​(at​,bt​)mt+1​nt+1​​=βEt​[Vt+1​(mt+1​,nt+1​)]s.t.=Ra​at​+θt+1​=Rb​bt​​

children.value: Then redefine the working agent's problem as

children.html: vt(mt,nt,W)=max⁡ct,dtu(ct)−α+vt(at,bt)at=mt−ct−dtbt=nt+dt+g(dt)\begin{split} \vFunc_{t}(\mRat_{t}, \nRat_{t}, \Work) & = \max_{\cRat_{t}, \dRat_{t}} \util(\cRat_{t}) - \kapShare + \vEnd_{t}(\aRat_{t}, \bRat_{t}) \\ \aRat_{t} & = \mRat_{t} - \cRat_{t} - \dRat_{t} \\ \bRat_{t} & = \nRat_{t} + \dRat_{t} + \gFunc(\dRat_{t}) \\ \end{split}vt​(mt​,nt​,W)at​bt​​=ct​,dt​max​u(ct​)−α+vt​(at​,bt​)=mt​−ct​−dt​=nt​+dt​+g(dt​)​

children.value:
Clearly, the structure of the problem remains the same, and this is the problem
that G2EGM solves. We've only moved some
of the stochastic mechanics out of the problem. Now, we can apply the
sequential EGM

children.html: n^nn

children.value: method. Let the agent first decide

children.html: dt\dRat_{t}dt​

children.value:
, the deposit
amount into their retirement; we will call this the deposit problem, or outer loop. Thereafter, the
agent will have net liquid assets
of

children.html: lt\lRat_{t}lt​
bt\bRat_{t}bt​

vt(mt,nt,W)=max⁡dtv~t(lt,bt)s.t.lt=mt−dtbt=nt+dt+g(dt)\begin{split} \vFunc_{t}(\mRat_{t}, \nRat_{t}, \Work) & = \max_{\dRat_{t}} \vOpt_{t}(\lRat_{t}, \bRat_{t}) \\ & \text{s.t.} \\ \lRat_{t} & = \mRat_{t} - \dRat_{t} \\ \bRat_{t} & = \nRat_{t} + \dRat_{t} + \gFunc(\dRat_{t}) \end{split}vt​(mt​,nt​,W)lt​bt​​=dt​max​v~t​(lt​,bt​)s.t.=mt​−dt​=nt​+dt​+g(dt​)​

children.value:
Now, the agent can move on to picking their consumption and savings; we can call this
the pure consumption problem or inner loop.

children.html: v~t(lt,bt)=max⁡ctu(ct)−α+vt(at,bt)s.t.at=lt−ct\begin{split} \vOpt_{t}(\lRat_{t}, \bRat_{t}) & = \max_{\cRat_{t}} \util(\cRat_{t}) - \kapShare + \vEnd_{t}(\aRat_{t}, \bRat_{t}) \\ & \text{s.t.} \\ \aRat_{t} & = \lRat_{t} - \cRat_{t} \\ \end{split}v~t​(lt​,bt​)at​​=ct​max​u(ct​)−α+vt​(at​,bt​)s.t.=lt​−ct​​

children.value:
Because we've already made the pension decision, the amount of pension assets
does not change in this loop and it just passes through to the post-decision
value function.
Solving the Inner Consumption Saving Problem

children.label: Solving the Inner Consumption Saving Problem

children.value:
Let's start with the pure consumption-saving problem, which we can summarize by
substitution as

children.html: v~t(lt,bt)=max⁡ctu(ct)−α+vt(lt−ct,bt)\vOpt_{t}(\lRat_{t}, \bRat_{t}) = \max_{\cRat_{t}} \util(\cRat_{t}) - \kapShare + \vEnd_{t}(\lRat_{t} - \cRat_{t}, \bRat_{t})v~t​(lt​,bt​)=ct​max​u(ct​)−α+vt​(lt​−ct​,bt​)
u′(ct)=vta(lt−ct,bt)=vta(at,bt)\util'(\cRat_{t}) = \vEnd_{t}^{\aRat}(\lRat_{t}-\cRat_{t}, \bRat_{t}) = \vEnd_{t}^{\aRat}(\aRat_{t}, \bRat_{t})u′(ct​)=vta​(lt​−ct​,bt​)=vta​(at​,bt​)

children.value:
We can invert this Euler equation as in standard EGM to obtain the consumption
function.

children.html: ct(at,bt)=u′−1(vta(at,bt))\cEndFunc_{t}(\aRat_{t}, \bRat_{t}) = \util'^{-1}\left(\vEnd_{t}^{\aRat}(\aRat_{t}, \bRat_{t})\right)ct​(at​,bt​)=u′−1(vta​(at​,bt​))
lt(at,bt)=ct(at,bt)+at\lEndFunc_{t}(\aRat_{t}, \bRat_{t}) = \cEndFunc_{t}(\aRat_{t}, \bRat_{t}) + \aRat_{t}lt​(at​,bt​)=ct​(at​,bt​)+at​

children.value:
. To sum up, using an
exogenous
grid of

children.html: (at,bt)(\aRat_{t}, \bRat_{t})(at​,bt​)
(ct(at,bt),lt(at,bt),bt)(\cEndFunc_{t}(\aRat_{t}, \bRat_{t}), \lEndFunc_{t}(\aRat_{t}, \bRat_{t}), \bRat_{t})(ct​(at​,bt​),lt​(at​,bt​),bt​)

children.value:
which
provides an
interpolating function for our optimal consumption decision rule over the

children.html: (l,b)(\lRat, \bRat)(l,b)

children.value: grid. Without loss of generality, assume

children.html: lt=lt(at,bt)\lEndFunc_{t} = \lEndFunc_{t}(\aRat_{t}, \bRat_{t})lt​=lt​(at​,bt​)

children.value:
and define the interpolating
function as

children.html: cˇt(lt,bt)≡ct(at,bt)\cTarg_{t}(\lEndFunc_{t}, \bRat_{t}) \equiv \cEndFunc_{t}(\aRat_{t}, \bRat_{t})cˇt​(lt​,bt​)≡ct​(at​,bt​)

children.value:
For completeness, we derive the envelope conditions as well, and as we will
see, these will be useful when solving the next section.

children.html: v~tl(lt,bt)=vta(at,bt)=u′(ct)v~tb(lt,bt)=vtb(at,bt)\begin{split} \vOpt_{t}^{\lRat}(\lRat_{t}, \bRat_{t}) & = \vEnd_{t}^{\aRat}(\aRat_{t}, \bRat_{t}) = \util'(\cRat_{t}) \\ \vOpt_{t}^{\bRat}(\lRat_{t}, \bRat_{t}) & = \vEnd_{t}^{\bRat}(\aRat_{t}, \bRat_{t}) \end{split}v~tl​(lt​,bt​)v~tb​(lt​,bt​)​=vta​(at​,bt​)=u′(ct​)=vtb​(at​,bt​)​

children.value: Solving the Outer Pension Deposit Problem

children.label: Solving the Outer Pension Deposit Problem

children.value:
Now, we can move on to solving the deposit problem, which we can also summarize
as

children.html: vt(mt,nt,W)=max⁡dtv~t(mt−dt,nt+dt+g(dt))\vFunc_{t}(\mRat_{t}, \nRat_{t}, \Work) = \max_{\dRat_{t}} \vOpt_{t}(\mRat_{t} - \dRat_{t}, \nRat_{t} + \dRat_{t} + \gFunc(\dRat_{t}))vt​(mt​,nt​,W)=dt​max​v~t​(mt​−dt​,nt​+dt​+g(dt​))
v~tl(lt,bt)(−1)+v~tb(lt,bt)(1+g′(dt))=0\vOpt_{t}^{\lRat}(\lRat_{t}, \bRat_{t})(-1) + \vOpt_{t}^{\bRat}(\lRat_{t}, \bRat_{t})(1+\gFunc'(\dRat_{t})) = 0v~tl​(lt​,bt​)(−1)+v~tb​(lt​,bt​)(1+g′(dt​))=0
g′(dt)=v~tl(lt,bt)v~tb(lt,bt)−1\gFunc'(\dRat_{t}) = \frac{\vOpt_{t}^{\lRat}(\lRat_{t}, \bRat_{t})}{\vOpt_{t}^{\bRat}(\lRat_{t}, \bRat_{t})} - 1g′(dt​)=v~tb​(lt​,bt​)v~tl​(lt​,bt​)​−1
g′(d)\gFunc'(\dRat)g′(d)

children.value: exists and is invertible, we can find

children.html: dt(lt,bt)=g′−1(v~tl(lt,bt)v~tb(lt,bt)−1)\dEndFunc_{t}(\lRat_{t}, \bRat_{t}) = \gFunc'^{-1}\left( \frac{\vOpt_{t}^{\lRat}(\lRat_{t}, \bRat_{t})}{\vOpt_{t}^{\bRat}(\lRat_{t}, \bRat_{t})} - 1 \right)dt​(lt​,bt​)=g′−1(v~tb​(lt​,bt​)v~tl​(lt​,bt​)​−1)

children.value: Using this, we can back out

children.html: nt\nRat_{t}nt​

nt(lt,bt)=bt−dt(lt,bt)−g(dt(lt,bt))\nEndFunc_{t}(\lRat_{t}, \bRat_{t}) = \bRat_{t} - \dEndFunc_{t}(\lRat_{t}, \bRat_{t}) - \gFunc(\dEndFunc_{t}(\lRat_{t}, \bRat_{t}))nt​(lt​,bt​)=bt​−dt​(lt​,bt​)−g(dt​(lt​,bt​))
mt\mRat_{t}mt​
mt(lt,bt)=lt+dt(lt,bt)\mEndFunc_{t}(\lRat_{t}, \bRat_{t}) = \lRat_{t} + \dEndFunc_{t}(\lRat_{t}, \bRat_{t})mt​(lt​,bt​)=lt​+dt​(lt​,bt​)

children.value: In sum, given an exogenous grid

children.html: (lt,bt)(\lRat_{t}, \bRat_{t})(lt​,bt​)
(mt(lt,bt),nt(lt,bt),dt(lt,bt))\left(\mEndFunc_{t}(\lRat_{t}, \bRat_{t}), \nEndFunc_{t}(\lRat_{t}, \bRat_{t}), \dEndFunc_{t}(\lRat_{t}, \bRat_{t})\right)(mt​(lt​,bt​),nt​(lt​,bt​),dt​(lt​,bt​))

children.value:
, which
we can use to
create an interpolator for the decision rule

children.html: dt\dRat_{t}dt​

children.value: To close the solution method, the envelope conditions are

children.html: vtm(mt,nt,W)=v~tl(lt,bt)vtn(mt,nt,W)=v~tb(lt,bt)\begin{split} \vFunc_{t}^{\mRat}(\mRat_{t}, \nRat_{t}, \Work) & = \vOpt_{t}^{\lRat}(\lRat_{t}, \bRat_{t}) \\ \vFunc_{t}^{\nRat}(\mRat_{t}, \nRat_{t}, \Work) & = \vOpt_{t}^{\bRat}(\lRat_{t}, \bRat_{t}) \end{split}vtm​(mt​,nt​,W)vtn​(mt​,nt​,W)​=v~tl​(lt​,bt​)=v~tb​(lt​,bt​)​
u′(⋅)\util'(\cdot)u′(⋅)
g\gFuncg
g(d)=χlog⁡(1+d)g′(d)=χ1+dg′−1(y)=χ/y−1\gFunc(\dRat) = \xFer \log(1+\dRat) \qquad \gFunc'(\dRat) = \frac{\xFer}{1+\dRat} \qquad \gFunc'^{-1}(y) = \xFer/y - 1g(d)=χlog(1+d)g′(d)=1+dχ​g′−1(y)=χ/y−1

children.value: The Post-Decision Value and Marginal Value Functions

children.label: The Post-Decision Value and Marginal Value Functions

children.html: vt(a,b)=βEt[V(mt+1,nt+1)]s.t.mt+1=Raat+θt+1nt+1=Rbbt\begin{split} \vEnd_{t}(\aRat, \bRat) & = \DiscFac \Ex_{t} \left[ \VFunc(\mRat_{t+1}, \nRat_{t+1}) \right] \\ & \text{s.t.} \\ \mRat_{t+1} & = \Rfree_{\aRat} \aRat_{t} + \tShkEmp_{t+1} \\ \nRat_{t+1} & = \Rfree_{\bRat} \bRat_{t} \end{split}vt​(a,b)mt+1​nt+1​​=βEt​[V(mt+1​,nt+1​)]s.t.=Ra​at​+θt+1​=Rb​bt​​

vta(at,bt)=βRaEt[Vt+1m(mt+1,nt+1)]s.t.mt+1=Raat+θt+1nt+1=Rbbt\begin{split} \vEnd_{t}^{\aRat}(\aRat_{t}, \bRat_{t}) & = \DiscFac \Rfree_{\aRat} \Ex_{t} \left[ \VFunc^{\mRat}_{t+1}(\mRat_{t+1}, \nRat_{t+1}) \right] \\ & \text{s.t.} \\ \mRat_{t+1} & = \Rfree_{\aRat} \aRat_{t} + \tShkEmp_{t+1} \\ \nRat_{t+1} & = \Rfree_{\bRat} \bRat_{t} \end{split}vta​(at​,bt​)mt+1​nt+1​​=βRa​Et​[Vt+1m​(mt+1​,nt+1​)]s.t.=Ra​at​+θt+1​=Rb​bt​​

vtb(at,bt)=βRbEt[Vt+1n(mt+1,nt+1)]s.t.mt+1=Raat+θt+1nt+1=Rbbt\begin{split} \vEnd_{t}^{\bRat}(\aRat_{t}, \bRat_{t}) & = \DiscFac \Rfree_{\bRat} \Ex_{t} \left[ \VFunc^{\nRat}_{t+1}(\mRat_{t+1}, \nRat_{t+1}) \right] \\ & \text{s.t.} \\ \mRat_{t+1} & = \Rfree_{\aRat} \aRat_{t} + \tShkEmp_{t+1} \\ \nRat_{t+1} & = \Rfree_{\bRat} \bRat_{t} \end{split}vtb​(at​,bt​)mt+1​nt+1​​=βRb​Et​[Vt+1n​(mt+1​,nt+1​)]s.t.=Ra​at​+θt+1​=Rb​bt​​

children.value: From discrete choice theory and from DCEGM paper, we know that

children.html: Et[Vt+1(mt+1,nt+1,ϵt+1)]=σlog⁡[∑D∈{W,R}exp⁡(vt+1(mt+1,nt+1,D)σϵ)]\Ex_{t} \left[ \VFunc_{t+1}(\mRat_{t+1}, \nRat_{t+1}, \error_{t+1}) \right] = \sigma \log \left[ \sum_{\Decision \in \{\Work, \Retire\}} \exp \left( \frac{\vFunc_{t+1}(\mRat_{t+1}, \nRat_{t+1}, \Decision)}{\sigma_\error} \right) \right]Et​[Vt+1​(mt+1​,nt+1​,ϵt+1​)]=σlog⎣⎡​D∈{W,R}∑​exp(σϵ​vt+1​(mt+1​,nt+1​,D)​)⎦⎤​

Pt(D ∣ mt+1,nt+1)=exp⁡(vt+1(mt+1,nt+1,D)/σϵ)∑D∈{W,R}exp⁡(vt+1(mt+1,nt+1,D)σϵ)\Prob_{t}(\Decision ~ \lvert ~ \mRat_{t+1}, \nRat_{t+1}) = \frac{\exp \left( \vFunc_{t + 1}(\mRat_{t+1}, \nRat_{t+1}, \Decision) / \sigma_\error \right) }{ \sum\limits_{\Decision \in \{\Work, \Retire\}} \exp \left( \frac{\vFunc_{t+1}(\mRat_{t+1}, \nRat_{t+1}, \Decision)}{\sigma_\error} \right)}Pt​(D ∣ mt+1​,nt+1​)=D∈{W,R}∑​exp(σϵ​vt+1​(mt+1​,nt+1​,D)​)exp(vt+1​(mt+1​,nt+1​,D)/σϵ​)​

v~ˋtm(mt+1,nt+1)=∑D∈{W,R}Pt(D ∣ mt+1,nt+1)vt+1m(mt+1,nt+1,D)\vOptAlt_{t}^{\mRat}(\mRat_{t+1}, \nRat_{t+1}) = \sum_{\Decision \in \{\Work, \Retire\}} \Prob_{t}(\Decision ~ \lvert ~ \mRat_{t+1}, \nRat_{t+1}) \vFunc_{t+1}^{\mRat}(\mRat_{t+1}, \nRat_{t+1}, \Decision)v~ˋtm​(mt+1​,nt+1​)=D∈{W,R}∑​Pt​(D ∣ mt+1​,nt+1​)vt+1m​(mt+1​,nt+1​,D)
